org.fhnw.aigs.server.gameHandling

Class GameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fhnw.aigs.server.gameHandling.GameManager

  • public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages all games. It creastes new games, lets players join games, loads Game classes and terminates games. Once a game has been initialized, the GameManager does not do much for the game, expect terminating it.
    Author:
    Matthias St√∂ckli

    • Method Detail

      • joinGame

        public static org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game joinGame(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.JoinMessage joinMessage,
                                                  org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player player,
                                                  java.lang.String partyName)
        This method initializes a game. As soon as a client sends a JoinMessage, it is passed to the game manager. The manager will check whether there are already games of the same type which could be joined. If that is not the case, it starts a new party. If the game is a single player game, the game will also be started immediately.
        Parameters:
        joinMessage - The JoinMessage sent by the player.
        player - A reference to the player who sent the JoinMessage.
        partyName - If desired, the player can join a named party.
        Returns:
        The newly created game.

      • joinRandomGame

        private static org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game joinRandomGame(java.lang.String gameName,
                                                         org.fhnw.aigs.commons.GameMode gameMode,
                                                         org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player player)
        Joins the first game in the list of waiting games with the same gameName.
        Parameters:
        gameName - The game's name.
        gameMode - The game mode.
        player - The player who wants to join the game.
        Returns:
        The game to be joined.

      • joinParty

        private static org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game joinParty(java.lang.String gameName,
                                                    org.fhnw.aigs.commons.GameMode gameMode,
                                                    org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player player,
                                                    java.lang.String partyName)
        Join a named game, called "party". It is possible to add a party name to a JoinMessage. The name will then be used to join other players who chose the same party name. The purpose of this method is to allow players to play the game with an exactly defined set of people. This could easily be used to build a lobby-like environment.
        Parameters:
        gameName - The game's name.
        gameMode - The game mode.
        player - The player who wants to join the party/game.
        partyName - The name of the party.
        Returns:
        The game to be joined.

      • createNewGame

        private static org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game createNewGame(java.lang.String gameName,
                                                        org.fhnw.aigs.commons.GameMode gameMode,
                                                        java.lang.String partyname,
                                                        org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player player)
        Creates a new game based on the game's name, game mode and a party name and adds it to the waiting games list.
        Parameters:
        gameName - The game's name.
        gameMode - The game mode.
        partyname - The name of a party (can be null).
        player - The player who creates the game.
        Returns:
        The newly creasted game.

      • loadGameFromJar

        private static org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game loadGameFromJar(java.lang.String gameName,
                                                          org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player player)
        Loads a game from a jar file. This method is being called if a new game is created. The method will use an URLClassLoader to load the class.
        Parameters:
        gameName - The game's name.
        player - The player who creates the game.
        Returns:
        The newly created game.

      • terminateGame

        public static void terminateGame(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game game,
                                 org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player terminatingPlayer,
                                 java.lang.String reason)
        Terminates a game and removes the terminating player before a message is sent to all players. This method is used when a single player can be identified as source. This method sends a ForceCloseMessage to all players.
        Parameters:
        game - The game to be terminated.
        terminatingPlayer - The player who closed the game or is otherwise responsible for the end of a game.
        reason - The reason why the game has to be terminated.

      • terminateGame

        public static void terminateGame(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game game,
                                 java.lang.String reason)
        Terminates a game and removes the terminating player before a message is sent to all players. This method sends a ForceCloseMessage to all players.
        Parameters:
        game - The game to be terminated.
        reason - The reason why the game has to be terminated.

      • getRunningGameById

        public static org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game getRunningGameById(long id)
        Get a running game by it's ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The game's ID.
        Returns:
        The game with the specified ID.

      • checkIfNameAlreadyExists

        public static boolean checkIfNameAlreadyExists(java.lang.String name)
        Checks whether a certain user name is already in use. This function is currently not used.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if the name is already in use, false if not.

      • sendMessageToAllPlayersOnServer

        public static void sendMessageToAllPlayersOnServer(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message message)
        Sends a message to all players on the server. It is not adviced to use this method.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be sent.
